medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started three months prior to the first clinic visit, after the patient returned from a five-month trip to Pakistan. Initially, intermittent fevers and fatigue were reported. Five months later, the patient experienced daily fevers, night sweats, nonproductive cough, and myalgias.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease, stroke, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease.
medical_history.social_history: Retired restaurant owner; history of smoking (60 pack-years, quit 12 years prior); no heavy alcohol intake or illicit drug use.
